Wait a minute, the rounds are different too. Cliff Webber was picked in round 4 (pick 93), and Albert Butts in round 5 (pick 116). So the draft picks aren't just 4 apart because they're in different rounds. Each round typically has multiple picks before moving to the next.

Also, the claim mentions the year 1985. The table doesn't provide any information about the draft year, so I can't confirm if this data pertains to 1985 or not. However, since the main issue is the pick difference and their order, the discrepancy there makes the claim false regardless of the year.

So putting it all together: Albert Butts was picked after Cliff Webber, but he was picked much later (23 picks after), not just 4. Therefore, the claim is FALSE.
